title: Automatic download doesn't work anymore...
comment: New episodes show in the list, but I have to manually download them. But overall, a great app for podcasts.

There are a number of settings that control when and if episodes are automatically downloaded. Check settings to see if something there could be tripping you up.  If not, we're happy to help diagnose the issue, please submit a bug report with more information here https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/issues

title: A refreshing change
comment: I had been using Podkicker for a while, but AntennaPod really just does the podcast thing so much better. First of all, it's pretty and it consistently loads podcasts' artwork. It also has useful sharing features and I like the way that it organizes episodes. My only complaint is that it exhibits odd back-button behavior, often bringing me back to Android home instead of the previous page in the app.
Love the automatic downloading and queue management.

title: Great, open source podcast app.
comment: Does just what I want.  Nothing more. And I mean that as a compliment. I have used other, fancy podcast apps. I like some of them, but they all pack features that I don't want. Waste of space and resources. This app strikes the perfect balance.

title: Promising
comment: Feels like an app that will be great, in the future, when it's finished. Inexplicably refuses to download some podcasts, very limited configuration options.
Can you please let us know which podcasts you're having trouble with?  https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/issues or https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/antennapod

title: Buggy McBug Bug
comment: Every major/minor release is so buggy that it takes a couple of hotfix releases for AntennaPod to be usable again. I know its FLOSS but a little more QA wouldn't hurt.

We try hard with QA. We don't have a budget to buy testing time on multiple different devices. Many of the bugs we've seen have to deal with devices that we don't have access to (and so can't test).  We have an active alpha/beta program, but they could use more participation and bug reporting.  Your participation in these programs would be welcome.

https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/issues/865

title: Very good, question about adding podcasts with lots of existing episodes
comment: Hi there,  This app is excellent, you guys are doing a great job.  I have a question about using the app. I added a podcast that has over a hundred existing episodes. I would like to listen to it starting with the oldest episode first because it is a serial and I'd like to follow the storyline.  Is adding each old episode to the queue manually the only way to listen oldest to newest? That's a lot of scrolling and clicking.  The way I understand antennapod's use seems great for staying current with podcasts, but difficult for listening to old casts.  Is there a way to use antennapod in that way?  I saw on github a feature request to "add all to queue", that would probably do it.  Also, I tried emailing the google group but it bounced back.  Thanks for your help, I greatly appreciate it.
This is a good suggestion and we're tracking it here. https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/issues/520  Please comment there to add any suggestions you might have.

title: well done!
comment: I like the new spacing in the layout, it gives the UI a cleaner feel, well done.   The app itself works without any glitches, has all the features, is open source, and ad-free. Pretty impressive.   I'm very grateful for the new feature allowing me to automatically delete episodes when playback is complete.  The only real problem is the widget. It has been consistently flaky ever since I started using the app.

title: Love it

title: Update: Good, simple Podcast App
comment: In general, AP is a great, simple podcast app. There was previously an issue with how Podcasts were organised, but this has been fixed in a new update. The developers seem keen to fix issues and continue to improve the app.  An area of improvement would be adding new podcasts: searching and browsing popular pods or recommendations would be useful.

We're aware of this issue and currently have fix in testing. You can track its progress here: https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/issues/750

We hadn't realized how many people used All Episodes exclusively.  I think this upcoming release will solve your problems.

title: All episodes listing restored. But one issue.
comment: One issue. When the app went into 1.0 release there was a change in the playback UI. Pressing description button (bottom), works but changes into an image button but is now at the top leaving a blank space where the description button was. This doesn't really make sense and is not consistent. A toggle btn. would be better. Pressing button at the bottom should toggle between the two instead of moving top to bottom. PS:is there a place to report bugs and suggest/change features? I saw a git repo, there?

I think you were using the app in a way we hadn't intended. Your method is probably something we should support better so I've added an issue to address it (hopefully soon): https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/issues/742

In the meantime, most of us use the app via the Queue, not from 'All Episodes'. You might have some luck giving that a try.

title: Clean interface
comment: I like the interface and look of this podcast player a lot, and the fact that it has some lockscreen controls is a huge plus for it.  In terms of what I'd like to see improved, there are a few things.  First, an easier way to add podcasts would be nice, like some kind of directory to search through. I had to add This American Life by pasting in the URL rather than using a search or selection activity.  Second, adding fast-forward and rewind to the lockscreen would be good.  Third, selection of items is a little clunky, and it takes too many clicks to perform operations on items in the list. One should be able to mark something unread in two clicks, but it takes three because the menu doesn't pop up automatically after selection.  Fourth, marking things read/unread, adding and removing to the queue, and managing the downloaded/not downloaded statuses of all of the items isn't as easy as it could be. It's kind of a pain to have to separately manage all of these statuses independently. Also, auto-removal from the queue seems to work, but auto-removal from the device doesn't seem to work.  And lastly, auto-downloading of items would be nice.  Overall though, a great app!

title: The Best!
comment: This is one of the best podcast apps hands down. Very nice, clean, and appealing UI. It functions just like it's supposed to and gives the listener the option to either download or stream. Only problem with it is the Miro Guide, it has a small selection but if you can't find what you're looking for just go to the Miro website and find your selections URL and you're set.

title: IMO, Best Podcast App
comment: Developer is quick to implement bug fixes and feature requests.
Really nice podcast player

title: Very nice thanks so much.
comment: No bugs what so ever and it's free too. Took me a bit of time to work out the feed URLs using Google search and type it in, but overall an extremely polished podcaster.

title: It works now!
comment: Since the last update I can now download podcasts without getting an error message

title: Cool App
comment: This is by far the best looking free podcast app I've found. The interface is pretty minimal, but it has pretty much every feature I'm interested in. Another thing I really like is that it doesn't require a million seeming unrelated permissions like the more popular podcast apps do. Definitely worth checking out now that Google has discontinued Listen.

title: Works well
comment: I wanted to like this app a lot, as it looks good and is minimalistic In a good way. However, I did have problems with one feed, but another worked well. It's worth giving it a shot.
